The blood vessels are well-defined without any signs of venous beading or intraretinal microvascular abnormalities.

vignette.vignette: 70-year-old with T2DM for 25 years. HbA1c 10.5%. Floaters, vision dimming. Access to care: Delayed referral.

llm_response.description: The retinal image shows multiple microaneurysms and small dot-blot hemorrhages scattered throughout the retina. There are also hard exudates present, particularly in the macular area. No signs of neovascularization, vitreous hemorrhage, or significant venous beading are observed.
